item.description:
Unfortunately, this is not being publicized as an official part of New Haven's Arts and Ideas festival, but:

In Celebration of World Refugee Day, IRIS [Integrated Refugee & Immigrant Services] is pleased to present a special screening of God Grew Tired of Us.
It's the inspirational award-winning fillm telling the story of three Sudanese ?lost boys?.

Tuesday, June 19, 2007

The MacMillan Center
Yale University
34 Hillhouse Avenue,
New Haven, CT

--The event begins at 5:30 p.m. with a wine and cheese reception.
--The film screening is at 6:30 p.m. followed by a discussion with some of the former ?Lost Boys? who have resettled in the area.

A $10.00 suggested donation benefits refugee services.

For more information contact Catherine Lincoln at (203) 562-2095 or clincoln@irisct.org.
______________________________________________________________________

More on the film here ; more on the "Lost Boys of Sudan" refugee settlement project here.

I don't expect a lot of RSVPs for this, with everything else going on, but if anyone else is interested I will be there by 6pm or so. I'll email my contact phone number to any people who are RSVPed "Yes" or "Maybe" on the morning of the event. (Your organizer for this is Michelle.)
item.name: Movie Screening + discussion with New Haven's own former "Lost Boys of Sudan"
